content.user_title: Create and Package Custom Skills for Claude
content.value_statement: Building effective Claude skills requires understanding proper structure and best practices. This skill provides a complete 6-step guide to create, validate, and package reusable skills for any domain.
actual_capabilities: Provides a structured 6-step process from skill concept to distribution
Explains skill anatomy including SKILL.md, scripts, references, and assets directories
Teaches progressive disclosure design for efficient context management
Guides validation and packaging with example commands
Covers iteration workflow for improving skills based on real usage
Includes examples for PDF editors, frontend builders, and database query skills
limitations: Contains only documentation and does not execute any code
Does not create files or directories directly
Requires user to provide domain-specific content and assets
Does not access external APIs or network resources

use_cases.title: Package institutional knowledge
use_cases.description: Create skills that capture company policies, database schemas, and workflows for consistent team responses across projects.

use_cases.title: Build reusable tool integrations
use_cases.description: Create skills with scripts for specialized tasks like PDF manipulation, API integration, or database operations.

use_cases.title: Customize personal Claude workflow
use_cases.description: Extend Claude with reusable templates and procedures for recurring personal or professional tasks.

prompt_templates.title: Start a new skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a new skill for Claude. I want to build a skill that helps with [TASK]. Walk me through the skill creation process.

prompt_templates.title: Plan skill resources
prompt_templates.prompt: What scripts, references, or assets should I include in my skill to support [USE-CASE]? Help me identify reusable components.

prompt_templates.title: Structure SKILL.md
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my skill plan for [TASK]. What information should go in SKILL.md versus references files for optimal context management?

prompt_templates.title: Validate and package
prompt_templates.prompt: My skill is ready. Walk me through the validation and packaging process so I can share it with others.

output_examples.input: Help me create a PDF editing skill
output: Step 1: Define concrete use cases like rotating pages, merging documents, and extracting text
Step 2: Identify reusable resources - scripts/rotate_pdf.py for rotation, references/pdf_commands.md for API docs
Step 4: Write SKILL.md with trigger conditions and script references
Step 5: Package with scripts/package_skill.py for distribution

output_examples.input: What should go in SKILL.md vs references?
output: SKILL.md: Core workflow instructions, when to use the skill, script locations (keep under 5k words)
References: Detailed schemas, API documentation, company policies, domain knowledge
Assets: Templates, images, fonts, boilerplate code used in output

best_practices: Start with concrete examples of how the skill will be used before designing its structure
Use progressive disclosure - keep SKILL.md under 5k words and store detailed content in references
Test skills with real tasks and iterate based on actual usage before packaging
anti_patterns: Putting all documentation in SKILL.md instead of using references for detailed content
Creating skills without clear trigger conditions in the name and description fields
Skipping user testing and iteration after the initial skill creation

faq.question: What tools support skills created with this guide?
faq.answer: Skills work with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Each tool loads skills based on name and description matching user requests.

faq.question: How large can my skill be?
faq.answer: SKILL.md should stay under 5k words for efficient loading. Bundled resources like scripts and references have no practical limit.

faq.question: Where do I install skills?
faq.answer: Place skills in the .claude/skills/ directory. Skills load automatically when their description matches user requests.

faq.question: Can skills access my files or network?
faq.answer: Skills contain only static documentation. They cannot access files, networks, or systems without explicit tool calls.

faq.question: Why is my skill not triggering?
faq.answer: Ensure name and description clearly describe when to use the skill. Claude triggers skills based on relevance to user requests.

faq.question: How do skills compare to MCP servers?
faq.answer: Skills are lighter than MCP servers and more focused than system prompts. They provide reusable context without code execution.
